cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi SSW of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeast Bahamas, forecast to skirt along or just north of Cuba, then turn northwest toward the Florida Keys and ultimately the northeast Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Haiti northern coast, southeastern Bahamas, and the Cuban provinces from Guantanamo westward to Ciego de Avila under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Bahamas, northern and central Cuba, Florida Keys, south Florida peninsula, and eventually the northeast Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤11%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (peak 39–45 mph) on Saturday; breezy squalls likely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected above minor tidal anomalies for the Atlantic side of south Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated pockets up to 8 inches possible Saturday–Sunday producing urban and street flooding in Miami-Dade County.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents beginning late Friday; possible brief waterspouts in outer rainbands.
